description: TO REFER THE NOMINATION OF JAMES MONROE AS SECRETARY OF STATE TO A SELECT COMMITTEE.  (P. 187, 189)
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF JAMES MONROE AS SECRETARY OF STATE.  (P. 187, 192)
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF JOHN R. FENWICK TO BE LIEUTENANT COLONEL OF THE REGIMENT OF LIGHT ARTILLERY. (P. 191, 193)

TO AMEND H.R. 8, (2 STAT. 669, 12/21/1811), A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE APPORTIONMENT OF REPRESENTATIVES AMONG THE SEVERAL STATES ACCORDING TO THE THIRD ENUMERATION, BY ELIMINATING THE WORDS, THIRTY-SEVEN, THUS LEAVING THE NUMBER OF REPRESENTATIVES TO BE APPORTIONED BLANK.  (P. 26)
TO AMEND H.R. 8, BY PROVIDING FOR A TOTAL OF FORTY REPRESENTATIVES.  (P. 26)
TO AMEND H.R. 8, BY STIPULATING THIRTY-FIVE AS BEING THE TOTAL NUMBER OF REPRESENTATIVES.  (P. 26)

TO AMEND S. 4, (2 STAT. 720, 4/29/1812), A BILL MAKING FURTHER PROVISIONS FOR THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS, BY ELIMINATING FROM SECTION FIVE THE FOLLOWING WORDS, "AT SUCH PLACE AS SHALL BE DESIGNATED BY THE PRESIDENT".  (P. 27)
TO AMEND H.R. 8, BY PROVIDING FOR THE SENATE TO APPOINT THREE MANAGERS TO GO INTO CONFERENCE ON THE AMENDMENT REJECTED BY THE HOUSE.  (P. 29)
TO ADHERE TO THE AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 8.  (P. 31)
TO PASS S. 5 (2 STAT. L. 669, 12/24/1811), A BILL FOR COMPLETING THE EXISTING MILITARY ESTABLISHMENT.

TO AMEND S. 6 (2 STAT. 671, 1/11/1812) A BILL RAISING FOR A LIMITED TIME AN ADDITIONAL MILITARY FORCE, BY ELIMINATING FROM SECTION ONE, LINE THREE, THE WORD, "TEN" REGIMENTS IN ORDER TO INSERT THE WORD "TWENTY" REGIMENTS.  (P. 34)
TO AMEND S. 6, BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISION THAT EVERY COMMISSIONED AND STAFF OFFICER TO BE APPOINTED IN VIRTUE OF THIS ACT SHALL BE A CITIZEN OF THE U.S.  (P. 34)

TO AMEND S. 6, BY ELIMINATING FROM SECTION 12 THE PROVISION GIVING ANY NON-COMMISSIONED OFFICER OR SOLDIER, DISCHARGED FOR FAITHFULLY PERFORMED DUTY, THREE MONTHS PAY AND ..... ACRES OF LAND, ALSO TO THE HEIRS OF THOSE NON-COMMISSIONED OFFICERS OR SOLDIERS WHO MAY BE KILLED IN ACTION, AND INSERTING IN LIEU THEREOF, THAT EVERY NON-COMMISSIONED OFFICER OR SOLDIER, AFTER SERVING 5 YEARS, OR BEING KILLED IN LINE OF DUTY, SHALL RECEIVE THREE MONTHS PAY AND A LAND WARRENT FOR 160 ACRES.
TO AMEND S. 6 BY ELIMINATING FROM SECTION ONE, LINE THREE, THE WORD, "TEN" REGIMENTS.
TO PASS S. 6.  (P. 85)
TO PASS S. 8, A BILL EXTENDING THE TIME OF CERTAIN PATENTS GRANTED TO ROBERT FULTON.  (P. 92)

TO AGREE TO THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO S. 6, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT COMMISSIONED OFFICERS FOR SIX ONLY OF THE SAID REGIMENTS SHALL BE APPOINTED UNTIL THREE-FOURTHS OF THE PRIVATES REQUISITE TO COMPLETE SUCH SIX REGIMENTS HAVE BEEN ENLISTED, WHEN THE COMMISSIONED OFFICERS FOR THE REMAINING SEVEN REGIMENTS SHALL BE APPOINTED.  (P. 96)

TO AGREE TO THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO S. 6, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT OFFICERS APPOINTED BY THIS ACT SHALL CONTINUE IN COMMISSION DURING SUCH TERM ONLY AS THE PRESIDENT SHALL JUDGE REQUISITE FOR THE PUBLIC SERVICE, THE PRESIDENT TO DISCHARGE THE WHOLE OR ANY PART OF THE TROOPS WHENEVER HE DEEMS IT SAFE FOR PUBLIC WELFARE.  (P. 96)
TO RATIFY THE TREATY BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE CHEROKEE NATION OF INDIANS MADE AND CONCLUDED AT CHICKAMOGGA ON THE TENNESSEE RIVER.
TO PASS H.R. 22, (2 STAT. 674, 1/14/1812), A BILL AUTHORIZING THE PURCHASE OF ORDNANCE AND ORDNANCE STORES, CAMP EQUIPMENT AND OTHER QUARTERMASTER STORES AND SMALL ARMS.  (P. 99)

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO THE BILL REGULATING THE COLLECTION OF THE DUTIES ON IMPORTS AND TONNAGE, WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSES TO INSERT AT THE END OF THE FOURTEENTH LINE, THE WORDS "UNLESS THE CLAIMANT SHALL SWEAR BEFORE THE COLLECTOR OF THE PORT THAT THE INVOICE HAS NEITHER BEEN RECEIVED BY HIM OR THEM NOR BY ANY OTHER PERSON FOR HIS OR THIER USE OR BEHALF."  (P. 103)
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF HENRY DEARBORN AS MAJOR GENERAL IN THE UNITED STATES ARMY.  (P. 206, 207)

TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL, IN ADDITION TO AN ACT SUPPLEMENTARY TO THE ACT ENTITLED AN "ACT CONCERNING THE COMMERCIAL INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND GREAT BRITAIN AND FRANCE AND THEIR DEPENDENCIES," UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY IN JUNE NEXT.  (P. 106)

TO POSTPONE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF A BILL IN ADDITION TO AN ACT ENTITLED "AN ACT SUPPLEMENTARY TO THE ACT ENTITLED 'AN ACT CONCERNING THE COMMERCIAL INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND GREAT BRITAIN AND FRANCE AND THEIR DEPENDENCIES,'" UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY IN MARCH NEXT. (P. 107)

TO REFER TO A SELECT COMMITTEE, THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY FURNISH THE HOUSE WITH A STATEMENT SHOWING THE NUMBER OF VESSELS, AMOUNT OF MERCHANDISE OF THE UNITED STATES AND TERRITORIES EXPORTED TO FRANCE, SUBSEQUENT TO THE REPEAL OF BERLIN AND MILAN DECREE, ALSO STATING THE AMOUNT OF DUTIES DUE TO FRANCE ON EACH ARTICLE AND AFTER SUCH REPEAL.  (P. 103)

TO POSTPONE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY FURNISH THE HOUSE WITH A STATEMENT SHOWING THE NUMBER OF VESSELS, AMOUNT OF MERCHANDISE OF THE UNITED STATES AND TERRITORIES EXPORTED TO FRANCE SUBSEQUENT TO REPEAL OF THE BERLIN AND MILAN DECREE, ALSO STATING THE AMOUNT OF DUTIES DUE TO FRANCE ON EACH ARTICLE BEFORE AND AFTER SUCH REPEAL. (P. 119)
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE AMENDED BILL FOR ESTABLISHING RULES AND ARTICLES FOR THE GOVERNMENT OF THE ARMIES OF THE UNITED STATES.  (P. 121)

TO REFER TO A SELECT COMMITTEE, THE AMENDED RESOLUTION PROPOSING TO DIRECT THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO EXHIBIT A STATEMENT OF THE NUMBER OF VESSELS, AMOUNT OF TONNAGE AND MERCHANDISE PRODUCED IN THE UNITED STATES AND TERRITORIES, EXPORTED TO FRANCE SUBSEQUENT TO REPEAL OF THE BERLIN-MILAN DECREE AND STATING THE DUTIES PAID IN PORTS OF FRANCE BEFORE AND SINCE THAT TIME.  (P. 147)

TO AMEND THE PROPOSED RESOLUTION TO DIRECT THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO EXHIBIT A STATEMENT OF THE NUMBER OF VESSELS, AMOUNT OF TONNAGE AND MERCHANDISE PRODUCED IN THE UNITED STATES AND TERRITORIES, EXPORTED TO FRANCE SUBSEQUENT TO REPEAL OF THE BERLIN-MILAN DECREE AND STATING THE DUTIES PAID IN PORTS OF FRANCE BEFORE AND SINCE THAT TIME, BY INCLUDING COLONIAL PRODUCE IN THE STATEMENT OF AMOUNT OF TONNAGE AND MERCHANDISE.  (P. 148)

TO AMEND H.R. 24, (2 STAT. 699, 3/30O1812), A BILL CONCERNING THE NAVAL ESTABLISHMENT, BY ADDING A NEW SECTION AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO CAUSE TO BE BUILT, FRIGATES OF A RATE NOT EXCEEDING 36 GUNS EACH AND AUTHORIZING A SUM FOR BUILDING SAID FRIGATES.  (P. 164)

TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION THAT THE PRESIDENT BE REQUESTED TO CAUSE TO BE LAID BEFORE THE SENATE, ANY INFORMATION RESPECTING THE NAMES OF ANY AND ALL PERSONS IN THE UNITED STATES WHO HAVE IN ANY WAY ENTERED INTO, OR COUNTENANCED THE VIEWS FOR THE EXECUTION OR ATTAINMENT OF WHICH JOHN HENRY WAS, IN THE YEAR 1809, EMPLOYED BY SIR JAMES CRAIG, THEN GOVERNOR GENERAL OF THE BRITISH PROVINCES IN NORTH AMERICA AND WHICH THIS DAY BEEN COMMUNICATED TO THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES. TO AMEND H.R. 193, (2 STAT 788, 12/12/1812), A BILL CONCERNING PAY OF NON-COMMISSIONED OFFICERS, MUSICIANS, PRIVATES AND OTHERS OF THE U.S. ARMY, BY ELIMINATING FROM THE 3RD SECTION OF THE BILL, THE PROVISION THAT EVERY PERSON ABOVE THE AGE OF 18, WHO SHALL BE ENLISTED BY ANY OFFICER, SHALL BE HELD IN THE SERVICE OF THE UNITED STATES DURING THE PERIOD OF SUCH ENLISTMENT, ANYTHING IN THE ACT TO THE CONTRARY, NOTWITHSTANDING.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT OF S. 46, (2 STAT 789, 1/2/1813), A BILL REMITTING FINES, FORFIETURES AND PENALTIES IN CERTAIN CASES.
TO PASS THE BILL, AS AMENDED, "AN ACT SUPPLEMENTARY TO THE SEVERAL ACTS NOW IN FORCE RELATIVE TO THE MILITARY ESTABLISHMENT OF THE UNITED STATES".
TO AMEND S. 45, (2 STAT 789, 1/2/1813), A BILL INCREASING THE NAVY OF THE UNITED STATES BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISION FOR BUILDING AND EQUIPMENT OF SHIPS OF SEVENTY FOUR GUNS. (P. 32)
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT OF S. 45, (2 STAT 789, 1/2/1813), A BILL INCREASING THE UNITED STATES NAVY.
TO PASS S. 46, (2 STAT 789, 1/2/1813), A BILL REMITTING FINES, FORFIETURES AND PENALTIES IN CERTAIN CASES.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL MONDAY NEXT, FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE APPOINTMENT OF A COMMITTEE TO INQUIRE INTO THE EXPEDIENCY OF TAKING POSSESSION OF EAST FLORIDA.
TO APPOINT A COMMITTEE TO INQUIRE INTO THE EXPEDIENCY OF TAKING POSSESSION OF EAST FLORIDA.

TO AMEND H.R. 216 (2 STAT 791, 1/20/1813), A BILL SUPPLEMENTARY TO AN ACT FOR THE MORE PERFECT ORGANIZATION OF THE ARMY, BY ELIMINATING THE FIRST AND SECOND SECTIONS OF THE BILL, PROVIDING AN ADDITIONAL MAJOR TO EACH REGIMENT AND AN ADDITIONAL THIRD LIEUTENANT TO EACH COMPANY.
TO AMEND H.R. 216, BY ELIMINATING IN THE 4TH SECTION, A BOUNTY OF $40 TO EVERY MAN WHO SHALL BE DULY ENLISTED INTO THE SERVICE AFTER FEB. 1ST NEXT TO SERVE FOR FIVE YEARS OR DURING THE WAR.

TO AMEND H.R. 216, BY INSERTING IN LIEU OF ELIMINATED BOUNTY PROVISIONS IN SECTION 4, AN ADVANCE OF $24 ON ACCOUNT OF HIS PAY IN ADDITION TO THE EXISTING BOUNTY, 1/2 OF SUCH ADVANCE TO BE PAID AT ENLISTMENT, THE OTHER 1/2 UPON JOINING SOME MILITARY CORPS.
TO AMEND H.R. 216, BY ELIMINATING THE FIRST SECTION, PROVIDING ONE ADDITIONAL MAJOR TO EACH REGIMENT.
TO AMEND H.R. 216, BY ELIMINATING THE SECOND SECTION PROVIDING ONE ADDITIONAL 3RD LIEUTENANT FOR EACH COMPANY OR TROOP.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF H.R. 216.
TO CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF JOHN ARMSTRONG TO BE SECRETARY OF WAR.

TO PASS A RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE MESSAGE AND REPORT RESPECTING EAST FLORIDA BE PRINTED CONFIDENTIALLY, FOR THE USE OF THE SENATE, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE RETURN OF TROOPS AND THEIR STATIONS ON THE SOUTHERN AND WESTERN FRONTS.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 52, A BILL PROVIDING FOR AN AMICABLE SETTLEMENT OF LIMITS WITH THE STATE OF GEORGIA AND AUTHORIZING THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A GOVERNMENT IN THE MISSISSIPPI TERRITORY IN OBEDIENCE TO THE PROVISIONS OF THE SUPPLEMENTARY BILL.

TO PASS S. 52, A BILL PROVIDING FOR AN AMICABLE SETTLEMENT OF LIMITS WITH THE STATE OF GEORGIA AND AUTHORIZING THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A GOVERNMENT IN THE MISSISSIPPI TERRITORY, IN OBEDIENCE TO THE PROVISIONS OF A BILL SUPPLEMENTARY TO THE ONE NOW ON PASSAGE.
TO AMEND H.R. 215 (2 STAT 794, 1/29/1813), A BILL PROVIDING FOR AN ADDITIONAL MILITARY FORCE, BY ELIMINATING IN SECTION ONE THE WORDS, "ONE YEAR", FOR THE PURPOSE OF INSERTING A LONGER TIME.
TO AMEND H.R. 215, BY INSERTING IN SECTION 1, THE WORDS, "DURING THE WAR", IN LIEU OF "ONE YEAR".
TO AMEND H.R. 215, BY INSERTING THE WORDS, "FIVE YEARS".
TO AMEND H.R. 215, BY INSERTING THE WORDS, "THREE YEARS".
TO AMEND H.R. 215, BY INSERTING THE WORDS, "18 MONTHS".
TO AMEND H.R. 215, BY ELIMINATING THE WORDS, "AS IN THE OPINION OF THE PRESIDENT MAY BE NECESSARY."
TO AMEND H.R. 215, BY ELIMINATING FROM SECTION ONE, THE WORD "ONE YEAR".
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF H.R. 215.
TO PASS H.R. 215.
TO CONSIDER THE BILL ALTERING THE BOUNTY AUTHORIZED BY LAW TO THE RECRUITS HEREAFTER TO BE ENLISTED FOR THE ARMY OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO PASS A RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE DOCUMENTS WHICH ACCOMPANIED THE PRESIDENTS MESSAGE OF THE 14TH INSTANT BE CONFIDENTIALLY PRINTED FOR THE USE OF THE SENATE, EXCEPTING PAPERS RELATING TO MILITARY FORCES OF THE U.S., THE REPORTS OF THE SECRETARY OF STATE AND LETTERS OF GENERAL PINCKNEY.
TO AMEND H.R. 198, (6 STAT 116, 2/2/1813), A BILL MAKING AN APPROPRIATION FOR CLAIM OF JARED SHANTUCK, BY ELIMINATING ALL AFTER THE WORD 'THAT' IN THE ENACTING CLAUSE.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY IN DEC. NEXT, CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 198.
TO PASS H.R. 198.

TO AMEND H.R. 185, A BILL AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO TAKE POSSESSION OF A TRACT OF LAND LYING SOUTH OF THE MISSISSIPPI TERRITORY AND OF GEORGIA, BY PROVIDING THAT THE PRESIDENT BE, AND HE IS HEREBY AUTHORIZED TO OCCUPY AND HOLD ALL THAT PART OF WEST FLORIDA EAST OF PERDIDO, AND THE WHOLE OR ANY PART OF EAST FLORIDA, INCLUDING AMELIA ISLAND.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT OF S. 18, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE CLAIM OF CHARLES MINIFIE.
TO PASS THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE SENATE ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF JONATHAN W. SHAW AS A SURGEON IN THE ELEVENTH INFANTRY REGIMENT.

TO POSTPONE UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY OF JUNE NEXT, FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO TAKE POSSESSION OF A TRACT OF LAND SOUTH OF THE MISSISSIPPI TERRITORY AND THE STATE OF GEORGIA.

TO AMEND H.R. 185, BY PROVIDING THAT IF HOSTILITIES SHALL BE COMMITTED BY THE SPANISH NATION, ITS COLONIES OR DEPENDENCIES, AGAINST THE UNITED STATES OR IF IT SHALL BE ASCERTAINED TO THE SATISFACTION OF THE PRESIDENT OF THE U.S. THAT THE SAFETY AND SECURITY OF THE UNITED STATES OR ANY PART THEREOF, ARE IN IMMINENT DANGER FROM SPANISH AUTHORITIES IN WEST FLORIDA, LYING EAST OF THE PERDIDO RIVER, THE PRESIDENT IS AUTHORIZED TO OCCUPY ANY PART OF THE LAND THEREOF, INCLUDING AMELIA ISLAND.
TO AMEND H.R. 185, BY PROVIDING THAT THE TROOPS OF THE UNITED STATES BE WITHDRAWN FROM THE PROVINCE OF EAST FLORIDA.
TO AMEND H.R. 231, (2 STAT 798, 2/8/1813), A BILL AUTHORIZING A LOAN NOT EXCEEDING SIXTEEN MILLION DOLLARS, BY ELIMINATING THE INTEREST RATE OF SIX PER CENT PER ANNUM.
TO AMEND H.R. 231, BY PROVIDING THAT THE STOCK TO BE CREATED SHALL NOT BEAR A GREATER RATE OF INTEREST THAN SIX PER CENT PER ANNUM, AND THAT IT SHALL NOT BE SOLD AT A RATE BELOW PAR.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF H.R. 231.
TO PASS H.R. 185.
TO PASS H.R. 231.

TO CONCUR IN AN AMENDMENT, MADE IN THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE, TO S. 58, A BILL INCREASING THE SALARY OF THE DISTRICT JUDGE OF THE DELAWARE DISTRICT, WHICH AMENDMENT ALLOWS EXTRA COMPENSATION ANNUALLY TO THE DISTRICT JUDGES OF MASSACHUSETTS, RHODE ISLAND, PENNSYLVANIA, DELAWARE AND NORTH CAROLINA, AND CHANGES TITLE TO "A BILL TO INCREASE SALARIES OF CERTAIN DISTRICT JUDGES".
TO AMEND S. 58, A BILL INCREASING THE SALARIES OF CERTAIN DISTRICT JUDGES, BY INSERTING THE WORDS, "TO DISTRICT JUDGE OF THE OHIO DISTRICT, $200".
TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION (2 STAT 830, 3/3/1813), ESTABLISHING DISCIPLINE IN THE ARMY OF THE UNITED STATES, BY EXTENDING THE PROVISIONS TO THE MILITIA AS WELL AS THE ARMY.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY IN DECEMBER, CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 207, (6 STAT 117, 2/25/1813), A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE RELIEF OF JOHN DIXON AND JOHN MURRAY.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF H.R. 207, (6 STAT 117, 2/25/1813), A BILL FOR THE CLAIMS OF JOHN DIXON AND JOHN MURRAY.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL MONDAY NEXT, CONSIDERATION OF S. 59, (2 STAT 829, 3/3/1813), A BILL VESTING IN THE PRESIDENT THE POWER OF RETALIATION IN THE CASES THEREIN SPECIFIED.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 230, (2 STAT 801, 2/25/1813), A BILL AUTHORIZING THE ISSUEANCE OF TREASURY NOTES FOR THE SERVICE OF THE YEAR 1813, WITH INSTRUCTIONS.
TO PASS THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE SENATE ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF THORNTON POSEY, TO BE A MAJOR OF INFANTRY.

TO AMEND THE BILL, TO REMOVE THE INJUNCTION OF SECRECY FROM CERTAIN PAPERS, BY PROVIDING THAT THE INJUNCTION OF SECRECY IN RELATION TO THE PAPER MARKED "A", COMMUNICATED IN THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE OF THE 26TH INSTANT, BE AND THE SAME IS HEREBY REMOVED.
TO PASS H.R. 207, (6 STAT 117, 2/25/1813), A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE CLAIM OF JOHN DIXON AND JOHN MURRAY.

TO POSTPONE UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY IN DECEMBER, CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION AMENDING THE CONSTITUTION RESPECTING THE MODE OF ELECTING REPRESENTATIVES TO CONGRESS AND ELECTORS OF PRESIDENT AND VICE-PRESIDENT.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING FOR AN AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION RESPECTING THE MODE OF ELECTING MEMBERS OF CONGRESS AND ELECTORS OF PRESIDENT AND VICE-PRESIDENT, BY PROVIDING THAT ELECTORS SHALL BE APPORTIONED AMONG THE STATES ACCORDING TO THE WHOLE NUMBER OF FREE WHITE PERSONS IN EACH STATE, INCLUDING THOSE BOUND TO SERVICE FOR A TERM OF YEARS.

TO AMEND S. 59 (2 STAT 829, 3/3/1813), A BILL VESTING IN THE PRESIDENT THE POWER OF RETALIATION, BY ELIMINATING THE WORDS, "PUNISHMENT FOR ENGLISH PRISONERS BEARING ARMS AGAINST THE U.S.," AND INSERT IN LIEU THEREOF THE WORDS, "PUNISHMENT IN ANY MANNER WHICH IN THE PRESIDENTS OPINION WILL BE LIKELY TO PREVENT FUTURE OUTRAGES".
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT OF THE BILL S. 59.
TO PASS S. 59.

TO POSTPONE, UNTIL THE FIRST MONDAY IN JUNE, NEXT, FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION AMENDING THE CONSTITUTION RESPECTING THE MODE OF ELECTING REPRESENTATIVES IN CONGRESS AND ELECTORS OF THE PRESIDENT AND VICE-PRESIDENT.
TO ADOPT A RESOLUTION AS AMENDED PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION RESPECTING THE MODE OF ELECTING REPRESENTATIVES TO CONGRESS AND ELECTORS OF PRESIDENT AND VICE PRESIDENT.

TO AMEND H.R. 230, (2 STAT 801, 2/25/1813), A BILL AUTHORIZING ISSUANCE OF TREASURY NOTES FOR THE SERVICE OF THE YEAR 1813, BY ELIMINATING FROM THE FIFTH SECTION GIVING THE AUTHORITY TO THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO ISSUE SUCH NOTES AS MAY BE EXPEDIENT IN THE PAYMENT OF SUPPLIES.
TO AMEND H.R. 230, BY ELIMINATING IN THE EIGHTH SECTION THE PROVISION THAT SAID TREASURY NOTES SHALL EVERYWHERE BE RECEIVED IN PAYMENT OF DUTIES AND TAXES LAID BY THE AUTHORITY OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF H.R. 230.
TO PASS H.R. 230.

TO AMEND H.R. 243, (2 STAT 811, 3/3/1813), A BILL GIVING FURTHER TIME TO PURCHASERS OF PUBLIC LANDS TO COMPLETE THEIR PAYMENTS, BY INSERTING IN SECTION 1 THE WORDS, "AT ANY OF THE LAND OFFICES NORTHWEST OF THE OHIO RIVER".

TO AMEND H.R. 243, (2 STAT 811, 3/3/1813), AN ACT GIVING FURTHER TIME TO PURCHASERS OF PUBLIC LANDS IN THE MISSISSIPPI TERRITORY TO COMPLETE THEIR PAYMENTS, BY PROVIDING THAT ALL SUMS POSTPONED BY THIS ACT SHALL CARRY INTEREST AT 6% PER ANNUM AND SHALL BE PAID TO THE STATE OF GEORGIA DURING THE TIME OF POSTPONEMENT IN ADDITION TO THE SUM $1,250,000 WHICH THE U.S. IS BOUND TO PAY OUT OF NET PROCEEDS OF THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS IN SAID TERRITORY WHICH INTEREST SHALL BE PAID OUT OF THE MONEY ARISING FROM THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT OF S. 67, (6 STAT 119, 3/3/1813), A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE RELIEF OF THE REPRESENTATIVES OF SAMUEL LAPSLEY.

TO POSTPONE, UNTIL THE FOURTH MONDAY IN MAY, NEXT, CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 240, (2 STAT 809, 3/3/1813), A BILL REGULATING SEAMEN ON BOARD THE PUBLIC SHIPS AND IN THE MERCHANT SERVICE OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO POSTPONE, UNTIL THE FOURTH MONDAY IN MAY NEXT, CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 240.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF H.R. 240.

TO AMEND H.R. 255 (2 STAT 823, 3/3/1813), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE GOVERNEMNT DURING THE FISCAL YEAR 1813, BY ELIMINATING $50,000 FOR THE CONTINGENT EXPENSES OF INTERCOURSE WITH FOREIGN NATIONS.
TO PASS H.R. 240.

TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF WADE HAMPTON TO BE A MAJOR-GENERAL.

TO CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF AARON OGDEN, TO THE RANK OF MAJOR GENERAL.

TO AMEND S. 69, (2 STAT 819, 3/3/1813), A BILL IMPROVING THE ORGANIZATION OF THE GENERAL STAFF OF THE ARMY OF THE U.S., BY ELIMINATING IN SECTION ONE, LINE SEVEN, THE WORDS, "SIXTEEN ASSISTANT ADJUTANTS GENERALS".
TO AMEND H.R. 248, (2 STAT 821, 3/3/1813), A BILL SUPPLEMENTARY TO THE ACT FOR INCREASING THE NAVY, BY ELIMINATING IN SECTION 1, LINE 4, THE WORD "SIX" AND INSERT IN LIEU THEREOF THE WORD "TWO".
TO AMEND H.R. 248, BY ELIMINATING IN SECTION 1, LINE 6, THE WORDS "OR TO PROCURE".
TO AMEND H.R. 248, BY ELIMINATING THE 7TH SECTION OF THE BILL, AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARIES OF WAR AND NAVY TO FIX THE RELATIVE RANK OF OFFICERS OF THE ARMY AND NAVY, TO BE APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT.

TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION THAT IN THE OPINION OF THE SENATE, IT WOULD HEREAFTER BE INEXPEDIENT TO ADVANCE AN OFFICER MORE THAN ONE GRADE, BY THE SAME NOMINATION; AND THAT THE DEPARTURE FROM THE PRACTICE IN THE CASE OF CAPTAIN MORRIS OUGHT NOT TO BE CONSIDERED AS AN IMPUTATION UPON THE MERIT OR SERVICE OF ANY OTHER OFFICER.
TO CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF THOMAS POSEY TO BE GOVERNOR OF THE INDIANA TERRITORY.
TO SUSPEND THE PART OF THE 12TH RULE WHICH REQUIRES THREE SEPARATE READINGS.

TO POSTPONE UNTIL THE FOURTH MONDAY IN MAY NEXT, CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 247, A BILL RELEASING THE CLAIMS OF THE UNITED STATES ON CERTAIN GOODS, WARES AND MERCHANDISE, CAPTURED BY PRIVATE ARMED VESSELS.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF H.R. 170, A BILL SUPPLEMENTARY TO THE ACTS ON UNIFORM RULE OF NATURALIZATION.
